location_name.instruction: Enter the name of the location.

location_port.instruction: Enter the name of the port.

location_other.instruction: Enter a brief description of the location.

sailing_condition_open_water.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship sailing in open water.

sailing_condition_occasional_ice.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship sailing in occasional ice.

sailing_condition_dodging_ice.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship dodging ice.

sailing_condition_leads.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship sailing in leads.

sailing_condition_ramming.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship boring, warping, tracking, or ramming in close pack ice.

sailing_condition_waiting.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship waiting for an opening in the ice.

sailing_condition_trapped.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship beset or trapped, in the ice.

sailing_condition_damaged.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship nipped or damaged beset by ice.

sailing_condition_wrecked.instruction: Transcribe the text describing the ship wrecked by ice.

sailing_condition_other.instruction: Transcribe any text describing the ship sailing with respect to ice.

help.title: Ice Field
help.body: **Ice fields** are sheets of ice too large to know how big they are.

sea_ice_concentration_ice_field.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __ice field__.

help.title: Floe
help.body: **Floes** are large pieces of sea ice tens to hundreds of yards across.

help.title: Drift Ice
help.body: **Drift ice** is a mix of large and small pieces of sea ice.

sea_ice_concentration_drift_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __drift ice__.

help.title: Sailing Ice
help.body: **Sailing ice** is so spread out that a sailing ship can navigate with ease.

sea_ice_concentration_sailing_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __sailing ice__.

help.title: Pack Ice
help.body: **Pack ice** is a large expanse of drift ice. ('Open pack' is when pieces of ice are close but not jammed together; 'close pack' is when pieces are in contact.)

sea_ice_concentration_pack_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __pack ice__.

sea_ice_concentration_other.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __sea ice concentration__.

help.title: Bay Ice
help.body: **Bay ice** is newly formed sea-ice, from near 0- to 1-foot thick. There are two forms: large, smooth sheets of thin ice, usually grey or grey-white in color; and 'pancake-ice,' circular pieces of ice of a few inches to several feet across. This may also be called 'young' or 'new' ice.

sea_ice_thickness_bay_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __bay ice__.

help.title: Sludge
help.body: **Sludge**, also called 'oatmeal' or 'porridge' ice, is formed when the sea is agitated when freezing.

help.title: Brash
help.body: **Brash** is a patch of ice made of fragments of older ice, or flinty pieces of icebergs (glacier ice).

help.title: Light Ice
help.body: **Light ice** is from 1 to 3 feet in thickness.

sea_ice_thickness_light_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __light ice__.

help.title: Heavy Ice
help.body: **Heavy ice** is from 3 feet and upwards.

sea_ice_thickness_heavy_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __heavy ice__.

help.title: Hummock
help.body: **Hummocks** are formed when pressure forces pieces of ice to pile up, and can be many feet thick.

sea_ice_thickness_other.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __sea ice thickness__.

help.title: Melt Ponds
help.body: **Melt ponds** are pools of water on the surface of the sea ice.

sea_ice_special_melt_ponds.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __melt ponds__.

help.title: Snow On Sea Ice
help.body: **Snow on sea ice** refers to any accumulation of snow atop any type of sea ice.

sea_ice_special_snow_on_sea_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __snow on sea ice__.

help.title: Land Ice
help.body: **Land ice** is sea-ice that forms fixed to the shore; now called 'fast ice.'

sea_ice_special_land_ice.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __land ice__.

help.title: Floeberg
help.body: **Floebergs** are pieces of sea-ice hummock; up to 60 feet in height.

help.title: Iceberg
help.body: **Icebergs** are large pieces of glacier ice (uncommon in the Pacific Arctic).

sea_ice_special_other.instruction: Include any additional comments regarding __special sea ice__.

sea_ice_date.instruction: Enter the date of the sea ice description

sea_ice_description.instruction: Transcribe the description of the sea ice

weather_sea.instruction: Enter the description of the sea state.

weather_other_description.instruction: Enter the weather description as best you can.

event_native_interaction.instruction: Briefly describe the interaction with natives.

event_other.instruction: Describe this event or transcribe any notable text.

art_illustration.instruction: Include additional comments or hit <ENTER> to leave blank.

art_other.instruction: Describe this artwork or transcribe any notable text.
